description:
Fixed bug in which the margin sizes vary (depending on the scale factor) while printing on the mac.

BUG=none
TEST=Ensure that the margin sizes while printing are consistent across different web pages on mac.


Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=94144

messages.text:
http://codereview.chromium.org/7471052/diff/1/printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc
File printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/7471052/diff/1/printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc#newcode131
printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc:131: CGContextTranslateCTM(context_, content_area.x(), content_area.y() * (-1));
Just do -content_area.y()

Also, add a blank line below this.

http://codereview.chromium.org/7471052/diff/1/printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc#newcode134
printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc:134: 
And remove this blank line.

http://codereview.chromium.org/7471052/diff/1/printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc
File printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/7471052/diff/1/printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc#newcode131
printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc:131: CGContextTranslateCTM(context_, content_area.x(), content_area.y() * (-1));
On 2011/07/25 22:21:50, stuartmorgan wrote:
> Just do -content_area.y()
> 
> Also, add a blank line below this.

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/7471052/diff/1/printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc#newcode134
printing/pdf_metafile_cg_mac.cc:134: 
On 2011/07/25 22:21:50, stuartmorgan wrote:
> And remove this blank line.

Done.
LGTM. Please fix the weird whitespace in the CL description before landing though.

Try job failure for 7471052-5 (retry) on linux_clang for step "compile" (clobber build).
It's a second try, previously, step "compile" failed.

subject: Fixed margins bug on Mac
